results.title: The Hurricane
results.brief_description: A wonderful film for its time, particularly in the special effects area. The plot has it all - romance and passion, heroes and traitors, adventure and devastation, climaxing with an epic disaster of the natural kind in the form of a hurricane. Based on the novel by Charles Nordhoff and James Norman Hall, adapted by Oliver H.P. Garrett, with screenplay by Dudley Nichols, “The Hurricane” is set on the French colonised island Manakoora in the South Seas ruled by the cold and ruthless Governor Eugene De Laage (Raymond Massey) along with his kind-hearted and sensitive wife, Madame Germaine De Laage (Mary Astor). However the main characters of the story are the island chief’s daughter Marama (Dorothy Lamour) and her handsome hero husband, Terangi (John Hall) who is wrongly jailed whilst visiting in Tahiti. With Terangi’s escape and bid to return to his wife and his island home the story takes on an intensity that finally erupts into a breath-taking and havoc-wreaking finale. A classic film with a cast including C. Aubrey Smith, Thomas Mitchell, John Carradine and Jerome Cowan.

results.title: Angels over Broadway
results.creator_credit: Ben Hecht, Lee Garmes and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Angels over Broadway is a stylish looking black and white crime drama which takes place on one rainy night in New York. In a nightclub on Broadway called the Pigeon Club a suicidal embezzler arrives, wet and hopeless. He is mistaken as a rich country hick ripe for hustling. An alcoholic playwright becomes involved and the plot unfolds. This film, written and directed by Ben Hecht who is famous for witty and sharp dialogue, is well acted with an impressive cast. The hustler and would-be gangster, Douglas Fairbanks Jr. is teamed with the good-time girl Rita Hayworth. With a fine script of ironic and poetic dialogue this dark drama is compelling. The noir themes of espionage, gambling, suicide and bad guys turning good are present in this shadowy, cynical and articulate film. With an Academy Award nomination for Best Original Screenplay this is a fine film located in the world of loners, hustlers and has-beens. Cast includes Thomas Mitchell and John Qualen.

results.title: The Great St Trinian's train robbery
results.creator_credit: Frank Launder, Sidney Gilliat, Leslie Gilliat, Braywild and British Lion
results.brief_description: The monstrous St Trinian’s schoolgirls with their headmistress, Amber Spottiswood, are on the move again. This time to Hamingwell Grange. But the Great Train Robbers have got there before them - and left two and half million pounds hidden under the stage. Desperate to retrieve their loot the train robbers pose as caterers at the school Parents’ Day, but they have not reckoned with the ferocity of the unbeatable girls of St Trinian’s! Cast includes Frankie Howerd, Dora Bryan, George Cole, Reg Varney, Raymond Huntley, Richard Wattis. Inspired by the drawings of Ronald Searle.

results.title: The Secret policeman's other ball
results.creator_credit: Julien Temple, Martin Lewis, Peter Walker and Amnesty International
results.brief_description: Featuring some of Britain’s most loved and highly respected entertainers of comedy and rock music, this filmed live performance at the Theatre Royal, Drury Lane, London is an absolute ball - witty, outrageous, political, funny, but most of all, entertaining. It combines the winning elements of comedy sketches including some memorable Monty Python skits, stand-up comedy, and music performances by such stars as Rowan Atkinson, John Cleese, Tim Brooke-Taylor, Graham Chapman, Alexei Sayle, Bob Geldof, Jeff Beck, Eric Clapton, Donovan, Sting, Phil Collins and even Australia’s own inimitable Barry Humphries. Also features a special guest appearance by Michael Palin. Presented by Amnesty International with all royalties from the video going to Amnesty International. Stage show directed by Ronald Eyre.

results.title: Bitter sweet
results.creator_credit: Herbert Wilcox, British and Dominions Films and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Based on Noel Coward’s operetta, this is the first version of “Bitter sweet” (later Hollywood version in 1940 starring Nelson Eddy/Jeanette MacDonald) featuring Anna Neagle, Fernand Graavey and Esme Percy. It tells the romantic tale of a now older Sarah reminiscing about her younger days and her first love Carl, a musician. Charming and melodic, this bitter sweet love story is beautifully filmed by prolific British director and producer, Herbert Wilcox (Nell Gwyn, No No Nanette, The Lady with a Lamp to name a few) assisted by the wonderful dialogue, lyrics and music of Noel Coward. NB: Sound quality is muffled.

results.title: Jack and the beanstalk
results.brief_description: A musical version of the very much loved classic fairytale combining live action with animation. Stars Gene Kelly as Jeremy Keen, a peddler who trades his magic beans for Jack’s cow, Bobby Riha as Jack, and Ted Cassidy as the voice of the giant. A wonderful blending of live actors with animated cartoon characters. Also stars Marian McKnight as Princess Serena.

results.title: The Man in grey
results.creator_credit: Leslie Arliss, Edward Black and Gainsborough Pictures
results.brief_description: First of the very popular British costume melodramas produced by Gainsborough and often thought of as the best in the collection, “The Man in grey” is a tale of intrigue that twists and turns its way to a dramatic conclusion. The story begins at an antique auction in London during WWII and then proceeds to flashback to 19th century regal England to the aristocratic world of Clarissa Richmond (Phyllis Calvert) and her loveless marriage to the rather indifferent Lord Rohan (James Mason) - the “man in grey”, whose sole intent is in fathering an heir. Clarissa soon finds herself distracted by the attentions of the handsome Rokeby (Stewart Granger) introduced to her by her old schoolfriend, Hester (Margaret Lockwood) who in turn falls for Lord Rohan. Deceit, love and betrayal weave their way into this web of treachery where circumstances and fate can only lead to a tragic conclusion. Magnificent performances by all four stars. Based on the novel by Lady Eleanor Smith, adapted by Doreen Montgomery with screenplay by Margaret Kennedy and Leslie Arliss.

results.title: Stage door [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Gregory La Cava, Pandro S. Berman and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: This witty, sparkling comedy about the trials of numerous aspiring stage actresses, features an array of fine performances from up and coming stars of the 30s. Katherine Hepburn plays Terry Randall, a naive heiress, committed to her craft who anticipates work materialising out of sheer professionalism and perseverance. Boarding at a theatrical residence, where an atmosphere of gay penury prevails, Terry’s housemates attempt to demystify her idealism with their realistic take on an actress’ life - the casting couch, sugar daddies, endless futile auditions and a dearth of work for the talented and talent-less alike. Sharing a room with Terry is Jean (Ginger Rogers) a sassy tap dancer, accustomed to clashing with her fellow thespians, who forms a truce with the secretly wealthy Terry. With the show business setting and putting-on-a-show structure of many classic Hollywood musicals, “Stage door” also contains dramatic turns that relay the dark side and perils of the business. Cast includes: Adolphe Menjou, Lucille Ball, Eve Arden, Ann Miller, Constance Collier. Adapted from the Edna Ferber and George S. Kaufman stage hit.

results.title: Thief of hearts
results.creator_credit: Douglas Stewart, Don Simpson, Jerry Bruckheimer and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Ray (John Getz) and Mickey (Barbara Williams) Davis were the perfect married couple, or so everyone thought. Bored with her workaholic and disinterested husband, Mickey turns to her diary as an outlet, writing down her innermost sexual fantasies and desires. This is until the Davis’ home is burgled and the robber takes off with not only an assortment of valuables, but also Mickey’s secret diary. The thief, Scott Muller (Steven Bauer), soon finds himself obsessed with Mickey after reading her diary and plots and plans his way into meeting and seducing her. Mickey and Ray’s life is turned inside out whilst Muller’s obsession almost destroys him. Erotic thriller of the 80s with 80s soundtrack featuring Giorgio Moroder and Melissa Manchester. Includes a cameo role by a very young David Caruso (of NYPD Blues TV series fame) and support cast including George Wendt and Christine Ebersole.

results.title: Stanley & Iris = Stanley and Iris
results.creator_credit: Martin Ritt, Alex Winitsky, Arlene Sellers, Lantana Productions and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A feel-good romantic drama with a social conscience, “Stanley & Iris” tackles the serious problem of illiteracy which affects one out of every five American adults. Recently widowed and working mother of two teenage children, Iris (Jane Fonda) is struggling, both financially and emotionally. Stanley (Robert DeNiro) lives alone with his elderly father and is unable to read or write, a problem he has lived with for his entire life. The two meet when Stanley comes to the aid of Iris after her handbag is stolen, soon discovering that they are co-workers from the same local commercial bakery. And so begins a friendship. However, it is not long before Iris becomes aware of Stanley’s problem and when he eventually loses his job because of his illiteracy, Stanley asks for Iris’s help in teaching him to read. The bond of friendship and support gradually draws Stanley and Iris together into an affair of the heart. Strong performances by DeNiro and Fonda provide depth and soul into what could have been a somewhat schmaltzy and overly sentimental film. Cast also includes Swoosie Kurtz, Martha Plimpton, Harley Cross, Jamey Sheridan, Feodor Chaliapin. Based on the novel “Union Street” by Pat Barker, screenplay by Harriet Frank, Jr and Irving Ravetch.
